Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Create a line with a start point at (0, 0) and an end point at (0.5435, 0). - Line 2: Create a line with a start point at (0.5435, 0) and an end point at (0.5435, 0.5435). - Line 3: Create a line with a start point at (0.5435, 0.5435) and an end point at (0, 0.5435). - Line 4: Create a line with a start point at (0, 0.5435) and an end point at (0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.0679 units in the positive Z direction. Part 2 Instructions Shape Description Construct a second rectangular prism that intersects with the first prism. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0.4755, 0.0679). Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Create a line with a start point at (0, 0) and an end point at (0.5435, 0). - Line 2: Create a line with a start point at (0.5435, 0) and an end point at (0.5435, 0.0679). - Line 3: Create a line with a start point at (0.5435, 0.0679) and an end point at (0, 0.0679). - Line 4: Create a line with a start point at (0, 0.0679) and an end point at (0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.0707 units in the positive Z direction. Note: This shape will intersect with the previous shape, forming a new solid where the two shapes overlap. Dimensions The length, width, and height of each part and the final shape are provided in the JSON. For Part 1: - Length: 0.5435 - Width: 0.5435 - Height: 0.0679 For Part 2: - Length: 0.5435 - Width: 0.5435 - Height: 0.0707 For the Final Shape: - Length: Not specified - Width: Approximately three times the height - Height: Approximately twice the width</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1:** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.25 x 0.18 x 0.25 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.75, 0.0. This will serve as the origin for the CAD model. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw six lines as follows: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.2517, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.2517, 0.0), ending at (0.2517, 0.0378) - Line 3: Starting at (0.2517, 0.0378), ending at (0.0378, 0.0378) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0378, 0.0378), ending at (0.0378, 0.2517) - Line 5: Starting at (0.0378, 0.2517), ending at (0.0, 0.2517) - Line 6: Starting at (0.0, 0.2517), ending at (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2517. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1825 units towards the normal direction and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for this part to combine the shape with any preceding CAD models. **Instructions for Part 2:** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is centered on a white background and measures approximately 0.25 x 0.48 x 0.25 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles and translation vector as Part 1. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw the same six lines as in Part 1 to create a closed shape. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2517. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same euler angles and translation vector as Part 1. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.4782 units towards the normal direction and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for this part to combine the shape with any preceding CAD models. **Instructions for Part 3:** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 10 x 5 x 2 units with the sloped side at a 45-degree angle. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles and translation vector as Parts 1 and 2. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw the same six lines as in Parts 1 and 2 to create a closed shape. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2517. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same euler angles and translation vector as Parts 1 and 2. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.75 units towards the normal direction and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for this part to combine the shape with any preceding CAD models. Note: The provided measurements may require rounding or adjustments depending on the CAD software's precision capabilities. Ensure that the measurements are consistent throughout the design process.</description>
